key_points: Hundreds of Facebook users have reported outages on the social networking site.
The outages have been reported since 9am according to DownDetector, with more than 400 people in the UK affected.
Users experiencing problems may be owing to individual internet connection issues or device problems, indicating the issue might not be widespread.
Users have taken to Twitter to inquire about the outages using the hashtag #FacebookDown.
A Facebook spokesperson acknowledged the outage, attributing it to a technical issue, which has been resolved.
This follows a major global outage earlier in the month affecting WhatsApp, Instagram, and Facebook, with tens of thousands of reports filed.
The outage had significant financial implications for Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, causing him to lose over £4.4 billion.
Mark Zuckerberg issued an apology for the disruption, emphasizing the effort to reconnect users.
The outage was traced back to a faulty configuration change affecting communication between data centers.
Facebook cited the disruption's impact on internal tools and systems used for day-to-day operations.
